content.summary: Defines Adobe’s unified product voice and how tone adapts based on user context and emotion.
principles: Speak with one voice across all products.
Adapt tone based on situational context and user emotion.
Ensure language aligns with visual and interaction design.

guidelines.title: Voice
guidelines.description: Our voice reflects our design principles and ensures consistency across products.
do: Use friendly, honest, and responsible language.
dont: Use overly opinionated, funny, or trendy language.
Invent new concepts or terms unless necessary.

guidelines.title: Tone
guidelines.description: Tone varies depending on the user’s context and emotional state. It exists on a spectrum from motivational to supportive.
do: Adjust tone based on user needs and emotions.
Use the tone spectrum to guide appropriate expression.
Be empathetic and supportive when users are frustrated.
dont: Use the same tone in every situation.
Ignore emotional context in critical moments.

examples.example: We’re looking out for you and cheering you on. You’ve got this!
We know you’re busy, so we’ll make this brief.
Here is the information you need.
We know you’re worried about this issue, and we’re here to help.
Something bad has happened and we understand how you feel. We want to inform, guide, and support you through this.
